body:
It's possible I was being *slightly* paranoid about the loading issue - but anybody that's ever had to chase down bizarre autoloader behavior (for instance, having a development server that only crashes on the *second* request with the "removed from the module tree but still active" exception) is probably equally wary.

My concern is more about costs-vs-benefits: making this change appears to have the following breakdown:

* Benefit: saves a couple characters worth of typing.

* Cost: triggers deprecation warnings in literally every Rails app that upgrades to Rails 4. The very bored and statistically inclined could figure out how much typing this *costs*...

* Cost: renders *every* document about AR associations slightly out-of-date. And I mean every one of them - `:class_name` has been an option since [commit zero](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/db045dbbf60b53dbe013ef25554fd013baf88134/activerecord/lib/active_record/associations.rb).

* Cost: very small but nonzero chance of causing obscure, difficult-to-diagnose load order bugs in upgraded applications.
